title: Drawing, Design for a New England State Senate Hearing Room, for "The Child Buyer", 1964–65
title_raw: Design for a New England State Senate Hearing Room, for "The Child Buyer"
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash; red, blue, and green watercolor, white gouache over graphite on white illustration board
description: Room interior with suggestion of pedimont upper center.  Pilasters (with bust on top) line side walls.  Double doors with pedimont and arched window above on back wall.  Ceiling has large American flag framed by two hanging fixtures on either sides.  On stage, two desks and three chairs along right wall.  Witness chair center.  Man at water cooler resting on table at left.  Man with object in hand can be seen through open door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a New England State Senate Hearing Room, for "The Child Buyer", 1964–65. Pen and black ink; brush and gray wash; red, blue, and green watercolor, white gouache over graphite on white illustration board. 
Gift of Eldon Elder Associates. 2000-13-2
